intro: Phyllanthus boivinianus, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing tiny seeds. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often toxic species. Phyllanthus boivinianus is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical properties remain under study.
